b. In the event that the total premium due is not paid to the Us (or the intermediary through whom this Policy or Bond was effected) on or before the inception date or the renewal date, then the insurance shall not attach and no benefits whatsoever shall be payable by Us. Any payment received thereafter shall be of no effect whatsoever as cover has not attached.

c. Premium Payment
    i. The payment of the premium when it is due will ensure the continuance of the Policy in force until the next premium is due;
    ii. This Policy will be renewed upon the payment of the premium when it is due either on a monthly or annual basis as applicable and stated in the Policy Schedule unless prior written notice of cancellation has been given in accordance with General Condition 3 or the Policy has otherwise been terminated.
questions: How does the timing of premium payment relative to the inception or renewal date affect the attachment of insurance coverage and the eligibility for benefits under the policy?
What are the consequences if a premium payment is made after the inception or renewal date in terms of policy attachment and benefit entitlement?
In what ways does the payment of premium ensure the continuance of the policy, and how does this relate to the timing of subsequent premium payments?
How does the policy handle renewal upon premium payment, and what conditions could prevent automatic renewal despite payment?
What role does prior written notice of cancellation play in the renewal process even if the premium is paid on time?
How does the policy address situations where the premium is paid through an intermediary, and what implications does this have for coverage attachment?
What is the effect of non-payment of premium on or before the inception date on the validity of the insurance contract and the insurer’s liability?
How does the policy distinguish between monthly and annual premium payments in relation to policy renewal and coverage continuation?
Under what conditions can the policy be terminated despite timely premium payment, and how does this interact with the renewal provisions?
How does the policy ensure that payment of premium is a prerequisite for coverage attachment, and what documentation or proof might be required to confirm this?
What happens if a policyholder attempts to make a premium payment after the inception date but before any claim arises, and how does this affect claim eligibility?
How does the policy address the scenario where a premium payment is missed but subsequently paid after the renewal date, particularly regarding the effective date of coverage?
In the event of cancellation under General Condition 3, how does this affect the policy’s renewal status even if the premium is paid?
How does the policy define the inception date and renewal date in relation to premium payment deadlines and coverage attachment?
What are the implications for coverage if the policyholder pays the premium on the renewal date but the insurer has already issued a prior written cancellation notice?
How does the policy treat premium payments made via different payment methods or channels in terms of timing and coverage attachment?
What is the insurer’s liability if the premium is not received on time but the policyholder claims benefits for events occurring after the late payment?
How does the policy ensure that no benefits are payable if the premium is unpaid at inception, and what mechanisms prevent retroactive coverage?
How does the policy address the continuity of coverage when premiums are paid on a monthly basis versus an annual basis, especially in relation to missed payments?
What are the procedural requirements for the policyholder to maintain coverage through premium payments, and how do these interact with cancellation and termination clauses?
